author: The Editorial Board
title: Wells Fargo’s Political Penalty
text:
The Dodd-Frank Act gave financial regulators more power and discretion, which some have used as a license to do whatever they want. The latest example is the Federal Reserve’s arbitrary and seemingly political punishment of Wells Fargo for retail banking blunders.
Janet Yellen on her way out as Federal Reserve Chair on Friday imposed a sweeping consent order on Wells to punish “recent and widespread consumer abuses and other compliance breakdowns.” To wit, its creation of as many as 3.5 million unauthorized consumer accounts...
